intro: Chicomendes rubiginosus, commonly known as the red-stain beggar-ticks, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine, sticky hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the daisy family. It is native to parts of South America and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Due to its invasive nature in some regions, it can pose a challenge to native plant communities.
